choices.C: When a DML operation is run on the base table
choices.B: When a column is dropped from the base table
choices.D: When the base table is reclustered
choices.A: When a column is added to the base table

questions.question_text: When does a materialized view get suspended in Snowflake?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
answer is B

questions.question_text: Which function returns the URL of a stage using the stage name as the input?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/security-access-control-overview#roles

There are a small number of system-defined roles in a Snowflake account. System-defined roles cannot be dropped. In addition, the privileges granted to these roles by Snowflake cannot be revoked.

choices.D: The privileges can be revoked by any user-defined role with appropriate privileges.
choices.B: The privileges can be revoked by an ACCOUNTADMIN.
choices.C: The privileges can be revoked by an ORGADMIN.

questions.question_text: What happens to the privileges granted to Snowflake system-defined roles?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer D.
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/account-usage/access_history
This Account Usage view can be used to query the access history of Snowflake objects (e.g. table, view, column) within the last 365 days (1 year).

Selected Answer: B
B is the right one

questions.question_text: How long does Snowflake retain information in the ACCESS_HISTORY view?
Which types of subqueries does Snowflake support? (Choose two.)

choices.D: EXISTS, ANY / ALL, and IN subqueries in WHERE clauses: these subqueries can be correlated only
choices.B: Uncorrelated scalar subqueries in any place that a value expression can be used
choices.C: EXISTS, ANY / ALL, and IN subqueries in WHERE clauses: these subqueries can be uncorrelated only
choices.E: EXISTS, ANY / ALL, and IN subqueries in WHERE clauses: these subqueries can be correlated or uncorrelated
choices.A: Uncorrelated scalar subqueries in WHERE clauses
